vars.value: [dann]'s personal spot for running code. Don't delete.
Level power document used to create rooms
Transforms newlines into break tags, akin to the [Writeup Formatter], but older. Possibly obsolete.
Legacy document about adfu, please leave for posterity.
MNFP and LF listing for people on the Honor Roll - primarily used while the system was under development
N-Wing's attempt at an integrated bug tracking system for the site.
The page with our PayPal links and previous campaign amounts. This is updated manually.
Anonyous Voting superdoc. More of a toy than anything else, but helps you to keep your voting anonymous.
Link to offsite for adfu document. Now relatively obsolete.
An old Easter Egg node by nate from a long time ago. Do not delete.
[panamaus]' personal spot for testing perl code. Don't delete.
The document where you sign up for a new user account.
A database monitoring utility. It shows the "slow" or hanging queries on the database. Basic explanation is included.
FAQ about how to submissions to the [Everything FAQ]
This is the regular user's document to create an e2node. This is different from the administrative version, [Create node]
The rooms on the system that one can visit in. Remember, they expire after two weeks in a cron job.
Another part of the old bug system. Do not use. It is pending phasing out.
The duplicates found document, for when multiple nodes are of the same title. This is a core system document, do not delete.
Instructions on how to contact bones in case of a discovered copyright violation by an E2 user. Mentioned in the FAQ, do not delete.
FAQ item
Rambling musings from the early days of BSI. Please leave for posterity.
An [ENN]-style listing with 25 as the default
Public document that clearly outlines policy. The users see it exactly the way the editors see it.
Javascript utility to alphabetize items.
Separate doc discussing some of the other buttons editors use to get their job done.
A basic README for the ekw theme, explaining some of the features.
Previous C! listing document
FAQ item
The document used to create and control E2 Collaboration Nodes.

Vitals superdoc that shows writeups that were submitted a year ago this day. This only shows writeups that have lasted. It's a little expensive to generate, so it could probably be moved to a cron job.
The old, old bug-tracking system. Do not use, it needs to be phased out.
WolfDaddy's loosely code-backed project to have an E2 family tree in place. It's self-contained and hardcoded so he can use it.
A component of the old bug-tracking system. Do not use.
Pointer to BSI main page. Please leave standing for "corporate"
